      • findKeywordObject

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject findKeywordObject(java.lang.String[] tokens,
                                                    org.json.simple.JSONArray keywords)
        returns the highest priority keyword object included in the users input. A keyword object has a higher priority the earlier it appears in the array of keyword objects in the JSON script file. So the keywords for the object at index 0 have the highest priority, and the object at the end of the array (the default) has the lowest
        Parameters:
        tokens - user's input split into array of words
        keywords - JSON array of keyword objects
        Returns:
        chosen keyword object

      • findDecomposition

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject findDecomposition(org.json.simple.JSONObject keywordObj,
                                                    java.lang.String input,
                                                    java.lang.String chosenKeyword)
        finds the best matching decomposition for a keyword using the input and returns it (the longer the decompositon matched, the better the match is)
        Parameters:
        keywordObj - the chosen keyword object
        input - the user's input
        chosenKeyword - the chosen keyword as a string
        Returns:
        decomposition object

      • chooseRecomposition

        public java.lang.String chooseRecomposition(org.json.simple.JSONObject matchingDecomp,
                                            java.lang.String[] words,
                                            java.lang.String chosenKeyword)
        given a decompositon rule, choose a recomposition rule at random and then return it to be printed
        Parameters:
        matchingDecomp - the matching decomposition object
        words - the user's input as an array of words
        chosenKeyword - the chosen keyword as a string
        Returns:
        a recomposition to be printed

      • substituteWildcard

        public java.lang.String substituteWildcard(java.lang.String recomposition,
                                           java.lang.String[] words,
                                           org.json.simple.JSONObject matchingDecomp,
                                           java.lang.String chosenKeyword)
        method substitutes the wildcard (*) at either the start or the end of the decomposition rule with the relevant text that the user input
        Parameters:
        recomposition - a recomposition string
        words - the user's input as an array of words
        matchingDecomp - the matching decomp object
        chosenKeyword - the chosen keyword as a string
        Returns:
        recomposition to be printed
